block.p: A headline and article in Business Day last Tuesday about a decision by TheStreet.com not to award prize money in the first round of its ''Beat the Street'' competition referred incorrectly to the reason for its action. Although TheStreet.com did say that some players used trading strategies that compromised the integrity of the system, it did not identify any of them or accuse any individual of ''cheating'' in the contest -- including J. McKeown, who was leading the contest.
